intro: Cheiridopsis carnea, commonly known as the pink ice plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. This succulent species is characterized by its fleshy, blue-green leaves and clusters of small, pink or purple flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, storing water in its thick leaves to survive dry conditions. The plant is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental appeal.
